body_html: Yes, Inception is known to be far smaller in terms of parameter count then VGG. The first version of Inception contained roughly 5M model parameters; VGG was >75M model parameters (I don't know the exact the number for VGG). As @vodp mentions, the primary reason for this difference in parameter count is due to the fact that VGG uses several large fully connected layers at the top where as Inception minimizes to just 1 layer for classification.

body: Yes, Inception is known to be far smaller in terms of parameter count then VGG. The first version of Inception contained roughly 5M model parameters; VGG was >75M model parameters (I don't know the exact the number for VGG). As @vodp mentions, the primary reason for this difference in parameter count is due to the fact that VGG uses several large fully connected layers at the top where as Inception minimizes to just 1 layer for classification.
